channel.title: Design on marabunta
channel.description: Recent content in Design on marabunta

item.title: prototype
item.description: The big picture Tasks are stored in a MySQL, a worker (scheduler) periodically check the schedules and creates, updates or remove tasks from a live queue that uses redis, rabbitmq, nats, etc as a backend. One or more clients consume the queue and via a bidirectional gRPC stream dispatch the task to the proper client, if the task is finished, the client updates the result/status via gRPC Unary if not task is re-queued.
